results.title: Eating your heart out [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Chris Warner, Maureen McCarthy and Trout Films
results.brief_description: Eating your heart out is about food, dieting, and obsessional eating, especially as they affect women and girls in Western societies. The film looks at four eating disorders: anorexia nervosa; bulimia; obesity; and a condition known as the fat/thin woman. It also examines the wider societal pressures on women that lead to these eating obsessions.

results.brief_description: A revealing documentary about the lives of six unemployed teenagers in the Ballarat region. It was made by the unemployed themselves.

results.title: Artreach (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Genni Batterham, Kim Batterham and Artreach Production Co
results.brief_description: Through a special awareness program organised by Artreach, disabled people are awakened to their own potential by using dance, drama and music-making.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.3
results.brief_description: This program is the final part of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. The program concentrates on the three main types of treatment that are offered to cancer patients - surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy. Specialists in these fields discuss the treatments and when it is appropriate to use them.

results.title: Understanding Cancer Pt.2
results.brief_description: This program is the second part of a three part documentary that looks at cancer. Presented by Professor Richard Fox of the Ludwig Institute of Cancer Research, this program focuses on the disease from the patient’s point of view. The patients who appear in this documentary discuss their experiences with treatment and talk about their physical and emotional reactions.

results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.

results.title: The Bradman era
results.creator_credit: Albie Thoms, ABC Video and Jack Egan
results.brief_description: This film, a companion to the book, traces the career of Sir Donald Bradman from the early 1930s through until 1948 when he led an undefeated Australian team in England in his last test series. The film also contains coverage of many of the controversial incidents during the “Bodyline” series in 1932-33 and shows the great players in action. Rated: G

results.title: The Battle for Bowen Hills
results.creator_credit: Garry Lane, Peter Gray and Crowsfoot Films
results.brief_description: The story of Brisbane working class residents’ protracted struggle to defend their homes against the inner city freeway proposals of the Queensland Government. This film was made for community groups under a similar threat and for those interested in multinational development and the political economy of transport. Narrated by Geraldine Willisee. (Also includes ex-Queensland Senator Russ Hinze).
